Hi Antenor

The Kukishin Ryu likes to use several Bo. Octogonal, I have one=
 made out of
Peach wood. Strange choice I know but it was a gift, the usual=
 Rokushakubo,
and a Bo wihich has nine rings on it. 4 at each end spaced ap=
art evenly, and a
ninth one in the middle. Not too sure why they have the r=
ings, maybe to
reinforce it. They have also in the past used kyushakubo. I =
tried to twirl one
once. I found it hard being 6ft (180cm)m so how a smalle=
r Japanese managed,
who knows. Not very practical. Mostly the Bo are made f=
rom Oak.

Paul Richardson


"Dr. Antenor Camili Penteado" <acpenteado@hotma=
il.com> wrote:
Hello My name is Penteado, Antenor Penteado. I am a new memb=
er of this 
group, so I would like to say nice to meet you to all the membe=
rs and wish a 
merry christmas and happy new year. I am a brazilian lawyer =
who love Samurai 
Culture and history and along my 61 years of age I have b=
een reading about 
such involving culture that I love.
It is a pleasure to =
be in touch with other people that enjoy getting to know 
more and more abo=
ut the Samurais and their history! There is a very 
interesting book about =
Bushido that I would like to recommend you highly. It 
is published in Spai=
n and its title is " Zen y Artes Marciales" (Zen and 
Marcial Arts) The wri=
ter is Taisen Deshimaru a master in Zen. Luiz C=E1rcamo 
Editor. San Raimun=
do, 58 - Madrid. This is one of the books I like the most 
about Zen and Ma=
rcial Arts. I know that there is a french edition, but I am 
not quite sure=
 if there is an english edition yet.
I have just read the new biography wri=
tten about Miyamoto Musashi that has 
some information about "Bo-jutsu".
I =
like Bo-jutsu and I would like to receive some information about the 
woode=
n bastons, its size and interesting information about this art!
so, once mo=
re nice to meet you!
I am sorry for my poor english
best wishes.
Antenor C.=
 Penteado
